solution_line_template: Each pair of boxes weighs {heavier_box_weight} pounds + {lighter_box_weight} pounds, or <<{heavier_box_weight}+{lighter_box_weight}={pair_weight}>>{pair_weight} pounds.
Each pair weighs {pair_weight} pounds, so the delivery trucks can carry {max_truck_load} / {pair_weight} pairs of boxes or <<{max_truck_load}/{pair_weight}={pairs_per_truck}>>{pairs_per_truck} pairs.

Steven has three trucks, so each trip can move {pairs_per_truck} * {num_trucks} pairs of boxes = <<{pairs_per_truck}*{num_trucks}={total_pairs_per_delivery}>>{total_pairs_per_delivery} pairs of boxes.

Each pair is a set of {boxes_per_pair} boxes, so each delivery contains {total_pairs_per_delivery} * {boxes_per_pair} boxes = <<{total_pairs_per_delivery}*{boxes_per_pair}={total_boxes_per_delivery}>>{total_boxes_per_delivery} boxes
